intro: Brachystelma volubile, commonly known as the climbing lithops, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
